intro: Doria serrata, commonly known as the serrated doria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. While not widely cultivated, it is valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
